revised_title: Observations of the Transit of Venus in 1874
tldr: This article describes the observations and measurements made during the transit of Venus in 1874 by J. B. N. Hennessey and Prof. Stokes. They used various instruments, including an altazimuth and an equatorial, to determine the time and coordinates of the event. The authors also discuss the phenomenon of a fringe of light observed around the limb of Venus during the transit, and they compare their findings with other observers' accounts.
